image.altText: An NDIS logo on a peach-coloured background. A hand is writing the words "reasonable and neccessary" next to a stack of coins

props.synopsis: Creating more services outside the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) and hinging access on impairment instead of medical diagnosis are among the key recommendations from a long-awaited review.

title.children: NDIS review recommends changes to access through need, not diagnosis

image.altText: Older woman in a red shirt sitting in a dining room.

props.synopsis: After growing up in an uninsulated house that sometimes reached 50 degrees Celsius during summer, Yvonne Parker decided to create an energy efficient home for her retirement.

title.children: Yvonne's power bills are less than $80 a month. Here's how she did it

image.altText: A man with stretchers, a septum ring and long grey hair and a beard.

props.synopsis: The Arizonan extremist linked to the Wieambilla siege was understood to be a figure in the shooters' lives for more than two years before they murdered three people.

title.children: Donald Day has been arrested in connection with the Wieambilla terror attack. Here's what we know

image.altText: A young girl poses with her hand on her hip.

props.synopsis: A trio of independent medical experts tell the inquest into Rozalia Spadafora's death there were issues with some of the treatment she received and communication faults that delayed her receiving a correct diagnosis.

title.children: Independent doctors find communication faults at Canberra Hospital delayed correct diagnosis for five-year-old

image.altText: A close up of a middle-aged man in a high-viz polo shirt and padded vest, speaking outside and gesturing with one hand

props.synopsis: The Australian mining magnate and climate campaigner lashes out at oil and gas supremos he says are "selfish beyond belief".

title.children: Andrew Forrest calls for fossil fuel bosses' 'heads on spikes' in extraordinary outburst

image.altText: Radar map of Cyclone Jasper

props.synopsis: Cyclone Jasper is currently south of the Solomons and was upgraded to a category three late yesterday afternoon.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper could intensify to category five overnight, forecast to hit north of Mackay

image.altText: Close up of Bruce Lerhmann.

props.synopsis: Lauren Gain worked in the Department of Defence at the time of the alleged rape in March 2019 and has today given evidence to Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins getting 'quite touchy' in club on night of alleged rape, witness tells court

image.altText: A photo of Emma King looking at her mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Mobile phones, smart watches and any other handheld or wearable devices will be banned from ACT public schools in 2024, bringing Canberra schools into step with the rest of the country.

title.children: What you need to know about Canberra's upcoming public school mobile phone and smart watch ban

image.altText: A woman with an open laptop puts her head in her hands

props.synopsis: It might seem like an impenetrable wall of numbers, but the National Accounts reveal in excruciating detail just how badly Australian working households are faring, and why.

title.children: Feeling broke and living off baked beans? The GDP numbers explain why

image.altText: The photo shows the silhouette of a woman walking inside Melbourne Airport as a plane prepares for boarding.

props.synopsis: Australia's aviation industry is facing a daunting holiday season as potential strikes, staff shortages and cancelled routes loom.

title.children: Air travel under pressure as crews threaten strike action, routes cancelled between major airports

image.altText: A oman and three children sitting in front of a tent set up with clothing being dried on a wire.

props.synopsis: The United Nations chief urged the UN Security Council to use its clout to avert "a humanitarian catastrophe" in Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: More than 1.8 million Palestinians displaced and all telecom services shut down in Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Major humanitarian groups unable to function in Gaza
Israel approves 'minimal' fuel entry increase for Gaza
Israeli military says they are encircling Hamas leader's house

image.altText: Taylor Swift, dressed in a black long-sleeved turtleneck and red lipstick, flexes her muscles in a photoshoot for Time.

props.synopsis: Time magazine names Taylor Swift their Person of the Year for 2023, bucking their tradition of recognising influential political leaders and acknowledging the global superstar as a "source of light" in a "divided world."

title.children: Taylor Swift named Time magazine's Person of the Year, beating Putin, King Charles III and Barbie

image.altText: A brunette woman and a brunette man sit on a step outside a house

props.synopsis: From iconic TV shows to beloved pop songs, Jewish culture and Christmas traditions have long been inextricably entwined.

title.children: These classic Christmas songs have one thing in common — they were all written by Jewish composers

image.altText: A woman who wears a black cap, glasses, jacket, blue tee, leans on a crutch, stands in a beige laneway.

props.synopsis: Health advocates say Australia is failing to offer "innovative and comprehensive" harm prevention services and we need to look to countries like Canada as overdose deaths rise.

title.children: Australia 'lags internationally' in harm reduction as drug overdose deaths continue to rise

image.altText: King Charles III smiles while wearing a grey suit with a blue tie with the Greek flag and a matching handkerchief

props.synopsis: A cancelled meeting with the Greek PM and King Charles's choice of tie has reignited debate over the return of the Parthenon marbles, which currently sit in the British Museum, to Greece.

title.children: For years Greece has asked for the UK to return ancient sculpture. Then, King Charles's tie entered the debate

image.altText: A young protester is arrested in black and white

props.synopsis: Baby boomers have been copping criticism from the day they were born, from being too left-wing and delinquent, to being too conservative and greedy, but researchers suggest much of the criticism doesn't stack up.

title.children: From birth to retirement, a 'bonkers' history of baby boomers getting blamed for everything

image.altText: Man wearing overalls in a garden.

props.synopsis: The Australian actor hopes Master Gardener, the new film by veteran director and screenwriter Paul Schrader, will spark debate.

title.children: Joel Edgerton's new Hollywood film has divided critics — which he says is what its director wanted

image.altText: A young woman with a cream button-down shirt smiles at the camera. She is outside.

props.synopsis: In the remote community of Maningrida in the heart of Arnhem Land, graduating high school is an accomplishment worth celebrating. Hundreds of people have packed into the school's basketball court to celebrate the graduation of six of their own.

title.children: As thousands of students finish their schooling, this remote NT community is doing graduation differently

image.altText: Plastic bag with the words '5 mini apples' on it, inside bag is mini apples

props.synopsis: Advocates say a simple change would stop Australian households from unwittingly throwing out perfectly edible food, and they are banding together to get the regulator on board.

title.children: Should we remove best-before dates on produce?

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses holds a swish paddle and a man next to her hits the ball.

props.synopsis: Usually in table tennis the aim is to hit the ball over the net, but in swish — aka vision impaired table tennis — a clever variation makes the sport accessible to all.

title.children: Inside the Australian sport where visually impaired athletes compete with fully sighted players, and you must clean your blood off the table

image.altText: Building materials at a house being built

props.synopsis: Follow the daily blog for all the latest news in business, finance and the markets.

title.children: Wall Street flat in trading, ASX set to fall, building approvals data to shed light on housing crisis ahead

image.altText: A woman with black hair sits on a chair in a lounge room setting

props.synopsis: The interventions aim to tackle stillbirth rates, but have been criticised for not striking the right balance between reducing risks and offering support for pregnant women.

title.children: 'Racial profiling at its worst': Hospitals recommending early birth inductions based on ethnicity

image.altText: Five people sit behind a long desk at the City of Canada Bay Council with the acting mayor raising his hand while he speaks

props.synopsis: A month after its long-serving mayor was found to have engaged in corruption by the state's watchdog, a City of Canada Bay Council meeting has descended into fiery exchanges and accusations of a cover up.

title.children: The explosive Sydney council meeting and the 'corrupt' mayor who won't quit

image.altText: An illustration with clouds in-filled with the Australian, UK and US flags

props.synopsis: The program is expected to work with US and UK spy networks to help national security agencies better detect threats.

title.children: Australia developing 'top secret' intelligence cloud computing system

image.altText: Perth Scorchers players celebrate

props.synopsis: The BBL has been stripped back, shortening the season to just 44 games a year ahead of schedule. Simon Smale writes that Cricket Australia's attempts to heal its golden goose may have come in the nick of time.

title.children: The stripped-back BBL13 hopes to prove that less is more

image.altText: A man with a guide dog.

props.synopsis: Guide Dogs Australia and Equal Opportunity SA are calling on the community to be more considerate of people with a disability amid reports some people using assistance dogs have been turned away by taxi and rideshare drivers.

title.children: Disability advocates concerned taxi, rideshare drivers are illegally turning away assistance dog users

image.altText: University of Nevada, Los Vegas Beam Hall

props.synopsis: The shooting at the University of Nevada is reported to have "multiple victims"

title.children: Las Vegas police says suspect dead at university campus shooting with 'multiple victims' killed

image.altText: A woman holding a sign in a dimly lit street, which reads "Johnson partied while people died"

props.synopsis: The former British prime minister says he is "deeply sorry", but maintains his government did its best.

title.children: 'Got some things wrong': Boris Johnson admits fault in COVID policies as families of the dead demand answers

image.altText: Bulleen resident standing in backyard, back-dropped by a busy construction site

props.synopsis: Residents in Bulleen say their complaints over North East Link construction noises are being met with "lip service" — but the authority managing the project insists it is committing to work through local concerns.

title.children: Residents near Melbourne road project offered 'bespoke' noise reduction — but only if they promise not to tell anyone

image.altText: A group of Brisbane Lions AFLW players cheer and embrace after winning a grand final.

props.synopsis: The AFLW season is done and dusted, but we're about to jump into the trade period and draft — where are the gaps that need to be filled for all 18 clubs?

title.children: What your club needs ahead of the AFLW trade and draft

image.altText: A police officer stands with his hands on his hips outside a police station.

props.synopsis: Eastlands shopping centre could be anywhere in Australia. It has the usual shops, and a growing youth crime problem. The Tasmanian government is moving to a new model of youth justice.

title.children: Youth crime is on the rise. Police say the 'patrol, catch, prosecute' model isn't working

image.altText: Two men walking, as seen from behind.

props.synopsis: A leading greyhound trainer who was banned for life after a potential animal lure was found on his property denies knowledge of its existence at an appeals hearing, claiming it may have been planted by activists.

title.children: Greyhound trainer banned for life suggests activists planted animal lure

image.altText: Caroline Wozniacki holds the Australian Open trophy after winning the 2018 final.

props.synopsis: The 2018 Australian Open winner and ex-world number one, Caroline Wozniacki, will return to Melbourne Park next month, as tournament organisers reveal some of the wildcards for the first major of the season.

title.children: Australian Open grants former champion wildcard as comeback continues

image.altText: Hats and other objects left in a sandy field

props.synopsis: The United Nations has held a hearing to air testimony of widespread sexual violence allegedly committed by Hamas-led militants against Israeli civilians on October 7. This is what we know about the investigation. WARNING: Readers may find some of the details in this story distressing.

title.children: Israel has levelled shocking allegations of sexual violence against Hamas. Here's what we know

image.altText: A picture of a horse racing course taken from the grandstand.

props.synopsis: The plans released by the NSW government confirm a revamped version of the multi-billion-dollar Metro West project will go ahead, after months of uncertainty due to concerns over cost and timeline blowouts.

title.children: Sydney racecourse set to be replaced by 25,000 homes as state government commits to Metro West project
